title: Fast & Furious 9: 'We're not just doing the same thing'
description: The film franchise is a huge Hollywood success story, but some critics say it's running out of ideas.

title: James Bond's French haunts give licence to thrill
description: Agent 007's famous hangouts in France still exist - so what are they like now?

title: What is the Great Reset - and how did it get hijacked by conspiracy theories?
description: A global Covid recovery plan by the World Economic Forum has inspired false rumours about the creation of a tyrannical world government.

title: Illegal gold miners stalk Amazon as authorities look away
description: Indigenous villages say they are under attack, as illegal mining and armed violence in the jungle rise.

title: How fashion designers flipped to athleisure during Covid
description: Couture fashion houses had to rethink their clothes to survive the pandemic but the switch may last.

title: Ros Atkins looks at the closure of Hong Kong's pro-democracy newspaper Apple Daily
description: Ros Atkins looks at the events that led to the closure of Hong Kong's pro-democracy newspaper Apple Daily.

title: Why has the Hoover Dam hit an historically low water level?
description: The largest US reservoir fell to its lowest level in history, threatening water and power supplies.

title: Wimbledon: Roger Federer's epic victory over Pete Sampras, 20 years on
description: At Wimbledon in 2001, a teenage hopeful took on the serial champion. It was a match for the ages - the only time two greats met.

title: Forced adoption: 'This is where my baby was taken from me'
description: Elspeth Ross is among thousands of Scottish women who were forced to give up their babies.

title: Nigeria child abduction: Kidnappers demand millions for a child's life
description: Kidnappers have seized more than 1,000 students and staff in raids on schools in northern Nigeria since December.

title: Euro 2020: England v Germany - pick your Three Lions starting XI
description: England topped their group at Euro 2020 with two wins and a draw - now who would you pick for their last-16 game against Germany?

title: PMQs: Fact-checking the debate over low rape prosecution levels
description: The level of rape prosecutions dominated early exchanges at Prime Minister's Questions.

title: Russian jets and ships shadow British warship
description: BBC defence correspondent Jonathan Beale reports from the deck of HMS Defender in the Black Sea as it was harassed by Russia's military.

title: HMS Defender: What will be the fallout from Black Sea incident?
description: BBC's Frank Gardner looks at what impact the Russia-UK confrontation off Crimea might have for global security.

title: Dalian Atkinson: PC guilty of former footballer's manslaughter
description: Dalian Atkinson's family say they are "hugely relieved the whole country now knows the truth".

title: UK denies Russia fired warning shots near British warship
description: The Ministry of Defence says no shots were directed at HMS Defender and no bombs dropped in her path.

title: US Open champion Thiem doubtful for Wimbledon with wrist injury
description: US Open champion Dominic Thiem is a doubt for Wimbledon with a wrist injury sustained during a match in Mallorca.

title: Lego aims to make bricks from recycled bottles on sale in two years
description: Firm says challenge is to make more environmentally friendly bricks strong enough to build Hogwarts.

title: Hungary PM 'scraps Euros visit' amid German LGBT row with Uefa
description: The decision comes amid anger that Uefa will not allow the Munich stadium to light up in rainbow colours.

title: Hong Kong pro-democracy paper to shut from tonight
description: The tabloid's closure, days after its assets were frozen, is a blow to media freedom in Hong Kong.

title: Covid: Wembley VIP fans will face restrictions - minister
description: Talks are ongoing over a possible quarantine exemption for some people attending the Euro 2020 final.

title: Should schoolchildren still have to self-isolate?
description: More than a quarter of a million children are absent from school in the UK because of coronavirus.

title: India v New Zealand: Ayjinka Rahane clips Trent Boult to BJ Watling
description: India lose their fifth wicket as Ayjinkya Rahane is caught behind by BJ Watling off Trent Boult as New Zealand continue to press for victory in the World Test Championship final.

title: Leasehold campaigners welcome new changes
description: Persimmon and Aviva commit to change in light of competition watchdog inquiry into sector.

title: Lloyds to close another 44 bank branches
description: The latest announcement means 100 Lloyds and Halifax branches will close this year.

title: Royal Academy apologises to artist Jess de Wahls in transphobia row
description: The arts institution says it "had no right to judge her views" after removing her work from its shop.

title: Somerset Noah's Ark Zoo elephant M'Changa dies in attack
description: The 12-year-old elephant called M'Changa died in an attack involving another bull elephant.

title: Streaming TV giants face tighter UK regulation
description: The government also confirms a consultation into whether to privatise Channel 4.

title: Euro 2020: Why are England players self-isolating?
description: Two England players are self-isolating after a Scotland player tested positive for Covid.

title: Giant panda gives birth to twins at Tokyo's Ueno Zoo
description: The cubs, which have not yet been named, are the first ever twins to be born at the zoo in Tokyo.

title: Brexit: How many more EU nationals in UK than previously thought?
description: Five years on from referendum, it turns out there were far more EU nationals in the UK than was thought.

title: Brexit: EU citizens given 28-day deadline to apply to stay in UK
description: The Home Office says people with a reasonable excuse for a delay can complete their forms later.

title: Leicester postman returns Father's Day letter sent to heaven
description: The eight-year-old girl has been posting letters to her dad, who passed away when she was four months.

title: The Papers: Foreign travel hope, and 'no Indyref2 before 2024'
description: A mix of stories lead Wednesday's front pages, including fresh hopes for changes to travel rules.

title: Pentagon UFO report: Here's what we know
description: A new report is expected to reveal what the US military knows about unexplained flying objects.

title: 'Heartbreaking' conditions in US migrant child camp
description: An investigation by the BBC has uncovered alarming conditions at a child migrant camp in Texas.
